    PCAGenomicSignatures - Contents

    Sehyun Oh

    July 15, 2020

    PCAGenomicSignatures_Contents.Rmd

    Setup

    Install and load package

    if (!require("devtools")) {
  install.packages("devtools")
}
devtools::install_github("shbrief/PCAGenomicSignatures")
    library(PCAGenomicSignatures)

    Download PCAmodel

    Currently, you can download PCAGenomicSignatures (711.2 MB) from Google Cloud bucket using AnVIL Bioconductor/R package. This model is built from 1,399 studies (containing 75,433 samples) and 7,951 common genes from each of 1,399 study’s top 90% varying genes based on thier study-level standard deviation.

    if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE))
    install.packages("BiocManager")

BiocManager::install("AnVIL")
    library(AnVIL)
wd <- getwd()
gsutil_cp("gs://genomic_signatures/refinebioRseq_PCAmodel_hclust.rds", wd)
PCAmodel <- readRDS(file.path(wd, "refinebioRseq_PCAmodel_hclust.rds"))
PCAmodel
    #> class: PCAGenomicSignatures 
#> dim: 7951 12436 
#> metadata(6): cluster size ... MeSH_freq updateNote
#> assays(1): model
#> rownames(7951): 5S_rRNA 7SK ... SLC16A3 SLC38A2
#> rowData names(0):
#> colnames(12436): PCcluster1 PCcluster2 ... PCcluster12435
#>   PCcluster12436
#> colData names(3): PCcluster studies silhouetteWidth
#> trainingData(2): PCAsummary MeSH
#> trainingData names(1399): DRP000499 ERP023890 ... SRP188526 SRP189762

    Quick Summary of main information

    • model(PCAmodel) : avgLoading matrix
    • studies(PCAmodel) : a list of character vectors, containing studies in each loading
    • gsea(PCAmodel) : a list of gseaResult objects of each loading (coming soon!)
    • mesh(PCAmodel) : a list of data frames containing MeSH information associated with each study
    • PCAsummary(PCAmodel) : a list of matrix (3 by 20) containing PCA summary of each study

    Accessors

    PCclusters/ avgLoadings/ model

    Average loadings (= avgLoading = PCclusters) is the main part of GenomicSignatures, serving as an index connecting new datasets and the existing database used to build it. You can access it through PCAGenomicSignatures::model (equivalent of SummarizedExperiment::assay). Rows are genes and columns are avgLoading vectors.

    Here, PCAmodel consists of 7,951 genes and 12,436 PCclusters.

    class(model(PCAmodel))
#> [1] "matrix" "array"
dim(model(PCAmodel))
#> [1]  7951 12436
model(PCAmodel)[1:4, 1:4]
#>            PCcluster1   PCcluster2    PCcluster3   PCcluster4
#> 5S_rRNA  0.0014536985  0.007203501  6.277371e-03 -0.019858317
#> 7SK     -0.0028296151 -0.004445093  4.778814e-03  0.008085082
#> A1CF     0.0026854929  0.007484668  3.097421e-03  0.001099322
#> A2M      0.0003207426 -0.002994387 -6.339345e-05  0.003361415

    Metadata

    Metadata slot of the PCAGenomicSignatures object contains information related to the model buildling.

    names(metadata(PCAmodel))
#> [1] "cluster"    "size"       "k"          "n"          "MeSH_freq" 
#> [6] "updateNote"

    cluster contains the cluster membership of each PCs from training dataset and size is the integer vector with the length of clusters, containing the size of each cluster. k is the number of clusters and n is the number of top PCs kept from each study in training dataset. MeSH_freq is the information on the frequency of MeSH terms assigned to training dataset. You can see that MeSH term ‘Humans’ and ‘RNA-seq’ are top ranked, which is very expected because the training dataset of this model is Human RNA sequencing. updateNote gives a brief character of this model.

    head(metadata(PCAmodel)$cluster)
#> DRP000499.PC1 DRP000499.PC2 DRP000499.PC3 DRP000499.PC4 DRP000499.PC5 
#>             1             2             3             4             5 
#> DRP000499.PC6 
#>             6
head(metadata(PCAmodel)$size)
#> [1] 7 7 6 7 2 2
metadata(PCAmodel)$k
#> [1] 12436
metadata(PCAmodel)$n
#> [1] 20
head(metadata(PCAmodel)$MeSH_freq)
#> 
#>                 Humans                RNA-Seq          Transcriptome 
#>                   1163                    591                    576 
#>                    RNA Whole Exome Sequencing        Sequencing, RNA 
#>                    372                    284                    277
updateNote(PCAmodel)
#> [1] "1,399 refine.bio studies/ no control/ no annotation-based gene subset"

    Studies in each loading

    You can find which studies are in each cluster using studies(x) method. Output is a list with the length of clusters, where each element is a character vector containing the name of studies in each cluster.

    length(studies(PCAmodel))
#> [1] 12436
studies(PCAmodel)[1:3]
#> $Cl12436_01
#> [1] "DRP000499" "ERP023890" "SRP028336" "SRP047192" "SRP069760" "SRP107366"
#> [7] "SRP109805"
#> 
#> $Cl12436_02
#> [1] "DRP000499" "ERP109789" "SRP072417" "SRP074544" "SRP100477" "SRP114518"
#> [7] "SRP136742"
#> 
#> $Cl12436_03
#> [1] "DRP000499" "SRP043364" "SRP126289" "SRP126741" "SRP145663" "SRP145862"

    MeSH terms for each study

    You can find MeSH terms associated with each study using mesh(x) method. Output is a list with the length of studies in training dataset, where each element is a data frame containing the assigned MeSH terms and the detail of them. The last column bagOfWords is the frequency of that MeSH term in the whole training dataset.

    length(mesh(PCAmodel))
#> [1] 1399
mesh(PCAmodel)[1]
#> $DRP000499
#>         score identifier               name
#> 1604326  4303  DRP000499             Humans
#> 1522299  2196  DRP000499      Base Sequence
#> 585485   1779  DRP000499 Chromosome Mapping
#> 112012   1338  DRP000499      Genome, Human
#>                                                                                                                                                     explanation
#> 1604326 Forced Leaf Node Lookup:humans, Genome, Human, CT Treecode Lookup: G05.360.340.350 (Genome, Human), CT Text Lookup: homo sapiens, CT Text Lookup: human
#> 1522299                                                                                                                              RtM via: genome sequencing
#> 585485                                                                                                                               RtM via: genome sequencing
#> 112012                                                                                                                                   RtM via: Genome, Human
#>         bagOfWords
#> 1604326       1163
#> 1522299        188
#> 585485           2
#> 112012          35

    PCA summary

    You can find the PCA summary of each study using PCAsummary(x) method. Output is a list with the length of studies, where each element is a matrix containing PCA summary results with SD/Variance/Cumulative.

    length(PCAsummary(PCAmodel))
#> [1] 1399
PCAsummary(PCAmodel)[1]
#> $DRP000499
#>            DRP000499.PC1 DRP000499.PC2 DRP000499.PC3 DRP000499.PC4
#> SD            59.0820395   16.41547959    6.57735211   6.138468877
#> Variance       0.8294267    0.06402863    0.01027943   0.008953383
#> Cumulative     0.8294267    0.89345534    0.90373477   0.912688157
#>            DRP000499.PC5 DRP000499.PC6 DRP000499.PC7 DRP000499.PC8
#> SD           6.029335660     5.8395765    5.45528370   5.186589571
#> Variance     0.008637856     0.0081027    0.00707134   0.006391913
#> Cumulative   0.921326013     0.9294287    0.93650005   0.942891966
#>            DRP000499.PC9 DRP000499.PC10 DRP000499.PC11 DRP000499.PC12
#> SD           5.109390133    4.771454262    4.739276238    4.647818869
#> Variance     0.006203049    0.005409643    0.005336925    0.005132931
#> Cumulative   0.949095015    0.954504658    0.959841583    0.964974514
#>            DRP000499.PC13 DRP000499.PC14 DRP000499.PC15 DRP000499.PC16
#> SD            4.595424773    4.447827854    4.404402705    4.309704712
#> Variance      0.005017858    0.004700705    0.004609365    0.004413286
#> Cumulative    0.969992372    0.974693077    0.979302442    0.983715728
#>            DRP000499.PC17 DRP000499.PC18 DRP000499.PC19 DRP000499.PC20
#> SD            4.294590080    4.189794081    4.150554112    3.912577804
#> Variance      0.004382385    0.004171117    0.004093353    0.003637416
#> Cumulative    0.988098113    0.992269230    0.996362584    1.000000000
